trial_identification.studytitle: Prophylactic antibiotics irrigation in seminal vesicoscopy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Outcome comparison of seminal vesicoscopy for patients with hemospermia with or without prophylactic antibiotics irrigation

interventions.interventions: topical irrigation of prophylactic antibiotics at the end of seminal vesicoscopy; amikacin 1.0g/20ml and 10ml for each seminal vesicle was irrigated only once for 1 minute at the close end of surgery. All the patients have one-month follow-up.
interventions.comparator: In treatment group topical irrigation of antibiotics was used while in control group no topical irrigation of antibiotics.

primaryOutcome.outcome: evaluation of hemospermia by semen test

secondaryOutcome.outcome: infection of seminal vesicle by transrectal ultrasound examination

trial_design.concealment: allocation involved contacting the holder of the allocation schedule who was “off-site”
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using a randomisation table created by computer software
trial_design.statisticalmethods: usually in clinic at least 30 patients in each group is necessary for strict statistical analysis.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: changhai hospital committee changhai road 168#, shanghai 200433

fundingsource.fundingaddress: the funding is from changhai hospital committee chagnhai road 168#, shanghai,200433

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: changhai hospital committee changhai road 168#, shanghai 200433

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Seminal vesicoscopy has been used to treat hemospermia. But whether topical irrigation of antibiotics is useful to prevent the infection is still controversial. By this study, we want to clarify the role of topical irrigation of praphylactic antibiotics in patients undergoing seminal vesicoscopy.
